'''Henry Ellis Daniels''' [[Fellow of the Royal Society|FRS]]<ref>{{Cite journal | last1 = Cox | first1 = D. | authorlink = David Cox (statistician)| doi = 10.1098/rsbm.2003.0008 | title = Henry Ellis Daniels. 2 October 1912 - 16 April 2000 | journal = [[Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society]] | volume = 49 | pages = 133 | year = 2003 | pmid =  | pmc = }}</ref> (2 October 1912 – 16 April 2000)<ref name=obit1>{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1111/1467-9884.00273 | title = Obituaries: Henry Daniels, Edwin J. Redfern | journal = Journal of the Royal Statistical Society: Series D (The Statistician) | volume = 50 | issue = 2 | pages = 213–215 | year = 2001 | pmid =  | pmc = }}</ref> was a [[UK|British]] [[statistician]]. He was [[President of the Royal Statistical Society]] (1974–1975), and was awarded its [[Guy Medal]] in Gold in 1984, following a Silver medal in 1947. He became a Fellow of the [[Royal Society of London]] in 1980. The [[Parry-Daniels map]] is named after him (together with the [[England|English]] [[mathematician]] [[Bill Parry (mathematician)|Bill Parry]]).<ref>{{Cite journal | last1 = Whittle | first1 = P. | authorlink = Peter Whittle| title = A Conversation with Henry Daniels | journal = Statistical Science | volume = 8 | issue = 3 | pages = 342–353 | doi = 10.1214/ss/1177010911 | year = 1993 | pmid =  | pmc = }}</ref><ref>{{MathGenealogy |id=57769}}</ref>

His family was [[Jews|Jewish]], of [[History of the Jews in Russia|Russian]] (partly [[Poles|Polish]] and partly [[Lithuanian people|Lithuanian]]) origin.<ref name="odnb">{{Cite journal | title = The Oxford Dictionary of National Biography | doi = 10.1093/ref:odnb/74126 | year = 2004 | pmid =  | pmc = }}</ref>

Henry graduated from the [[University of Edinburgh]] and went on to study at [[Clare College, Cambridge|Clare College]] of the [[University of Cambridge]].<ref name=obit1/> In 1957, he became the first Professor of Mathematical Statistics at the [[University of Birmingham]].<ref name=obit1/> He stayed at the university till his retirement in 1978. After retirement, he went to Cambridge and lived there until his death.<ref>{{cite news|last=Whittle|first=Peter|title=Obituary: Henry Daniels|url=http://www.theguardian.com/news/2000/may/04/guardianobituaries1|accessdate=24 September 2013|newspaper=The Guardian|date=4 May 2000}}</ref>
